Title: N. Korea appears to be building new 4,000-ton warship with vertic...
Description: North Korea has launched the construction of what appears to be a 4,000-ton frigate equipped with a vertical launching system, South Korea's military said, as Pyongyang seeks to advance its nuclear and missile weapons.

Title: How Trump defense pick points to focus shift from North Korea to ...
Description: U.S. president-elect Donald Trump's pick for senior defence official may signal his incoming administration's move to adjust the role of U.S. troops in South Korea to focus more on containing China, according to analysts.

Title: Scores of Ukrainian, Russian POWs head back home after swap
Description: Ukraine and Russia carried out a new exchange of prisoners of war on Monday, with the two sides bringing home a combined total of more than 300 former captives.

Title: Elon Musk wants weak Europe, says Germany's vice chancellor
Description: U.S. billionaire Elon Musk's support for Germany's far-right Alternative for Germany (AfD) is a 'logical and systematic' play for a weak Europe that will not be able to regulate as strongly, Vice Chancellor Robert Habeck said in his New Year's address.

Title: Biden announces nearly $2.5 bil. more in military aid for Ukraine
Description: President Joe Biden said Monday that the United States will send nearly $2.5 billion more in weapons to Ukraine as his administration works quickly to spend all the money it has available to help Kyiv fight off Russia before President-elect Donald Trump takes office.

Title: Treasury says Chinese hackers remotely accessed workstations, doc...
Description: Chinese hackers remotely accessed several U.S. Treasury Department workstations and unclassified documents after compromising a third-party software service provider, the agency said Monday.

Title: Jimmy Carter funeral service to be held at Washington National Ca...
Description: A state funeral for Jimmy Carter, the former U.S. president who died on Sunday at the age of 100, will be held at the Washington National Cathedral on Jan. 9, according to the U.S. Army. U.S. President Joe Biden, who last year said that Carter had asked him to deliver the eulogy at his funeral, has directed that Jan. 9 be a national day of mourning for Carter throughout the U.S. The official six-day state funeral for Carter begins on Saturday as his remains travel by motorcade through his hometown of Plains, Georgia, the Army said in a statement.

Title: N. Korean leader visits new coastal tourist zone, emphasizes adva...
Description: North Korean leader Kim Jong-un has inspected a new tourist zone along the country's east coast, stressing that the project is the 'first big step' in advancing the country's tourism, state media reported Tuesday.

Title: N. Korea's Kim sends letter to Putin, vowing to further solidify ...
Description: North Korean leader Kim Jong-un has sent a New Year's letter to Russian President Vladimir Putin, vowing to further solidify bilateral military cooperation, the North's state media reported Tuesday.

Title: How American presidents have planned their own funerals
Description: Jimmy Carter's memorial journey will end at his house in the tiny town of Plains, Georgia, where he grew up on a peanut farm. That is where his wife, Rosalynn , was laid to rest last year in a burial plot that they chose years ago.

Title: US announces $2.5 bil. security assistance package for Ukraine
Description: The United States announced Monday a $2.5 billion security assistance package for Ukraine as Washington races to provide aid to Kyiv before President-elect Donald Trump takes office.

Title: German government seeks to downplay Musk's backing of far-right p...
Description: The German government on Monday sought to downplay efforts by tech entrepreneur Elon Musk to get involved in the country's general election campaign by again endorsing the far-right Alternative for Germany, or AfD, party.

Title: China's Xi 'deeply saddened' by Jimmy Carter death: CCTV
Description: Chinese leader Xi Jinping told his American counterpart Joe Biden that he was 'deeply saddened' by the death aged 100 of former U.S. president Jimmy Carter, state media said Monday.

Title: Flights temporarily suspended at Halifax airport after airplane l...
Description: An aircraft incident at the Halifax Stanfield International Airport caused temporary delays to all flight operations Saturday night.

Title: Key moments in life of Jimmy Carter
Description: Jimmy Carter's 1977-1981 presidency included successes like the Camp David peace accords, but also enough controversy for U.S. voters to see him as weak - and send him packing after only one term.

Title: Jet crash disaster in Korea marks another setback for Boeing
Description: A machinists strike. Another safety problem involving its troubled top-selling airliner. A plunging stock price.

Title: N. Korea's Kim visits new fish farm, urges regional economic deve...
Description: North Korean leader Kim Jong-un has visited a newly completed fish farm in the east coastal city of Sinpho and called for regional development to achieve regional economic self-reliance, state media reported Monday.

Title: Former US president Jimmy Carter dies aged 100
Description: Jimmy Carter, the 100-year-old former U.S. president and Nobel peace laureate who rose from humble beginnings in rural Georgia to lead the nation from 1977 to 1981, has died, his nonprofit foundation said Sunday.

Title: Biden says he is 'deeply saddened' by loss of life in Jeju Air cr...
Description: U.S. President Joe Biden said Sunday that he and first lady Jill Biden are 'deeply saddened' to learn of the loss of life in a deadly plane crash in Korea, while pledging to provide any necessary assistance.

Title: US transportation authorities to assist Korea's probe into Jeju A...
Description: Transportation safety authorities of the United States plan to help their Korean counterparts with a probe into the cause of a deadly Jeju Air plane crash that claimed 179 lives, according to a U.S. official Monday.

Title: China's growing appetite for durian spurs market innovations
Description: China's middle class consumers have been tightening their purse strings, but their appetite for durian - pungent, spiky fruit mostly imported from Southeast Asia - continues to grow.

Title: Putin apologizes for 'tragic incident' but stops short of saying ...
Description: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Saturday apologized to his Azerbaijani counterpart for what he called a 'tragic incident' following the crash of an Azerbaijani airliner in Kazakhstan that killed 38 people, but stopped short of acknowledging that Moscow was responsible.

Title: Trump sides with Musk in right-wing row over worker visas
Description: Donald Trump weighed in Saturday in a bitter debate dividing his traditional supporters and tech barons like Elon Musk, saying that he backs a special visa program that helps highly skilled workers enter the country.

Title: N. Korea declares strongest response strategy toward US at key pa...
Description: North Korea has declared its strongest response strategy toward the United States during a year-end plenary party meeting, asserting that the military cooperation among South Korea, the U.S., and Japan is evolving into an invasive nuclear military bloc, state media reported Sunday.

Title: Ukraine discloses diary of fallen NK soldier
Description: Ukraine's military on Saturday disclosed the diary of a North Korean soldier killed in action in Russia's western front-line region of Kursk.

Title: Donald Trump asks US Supreme Court to halt TikTok ban
Description: U.S. president-elect Donald Trump on Friday filed an amicus brief with the U.S. Supreme Court in TikTok's legal case, urging the justices to temporarily halt a law requiring the popular app to be banned by January 19 unless it is sold to a non-Chinese buyer.

Title: Olivia Hussey, star of 1968 film 'Romeo and Juliet,' dies at 73
Description: Olivia Hussey, the actor who starred as a teenage Juliet in the 1968 film 'Romeo and Juliet,' has died, her family said on social media Saturday. She was 73.

Title: US homelessness up 18% as affordable housing remains out of reach...
Description: The United States saw an 18.1 percent increase in homelessness this year, a dramatic rise driven mostly by a lack of affordable housing as well as devastating natural disasters and a surge of migrants in several parts of the country, federal officials said Friday.

Title: Winning ticket sold for bonanza $1.22 bil. US lottery
Description: A winning ticket has been sold for a United States lottery jackpot of $1.22 billion, its organizer said Saturday, one of largest prizes in the history of the gambling game.

Title: Israeli forces raid north Gaza hospital, health ministry says con...
Description: Israeli forces raided the Kamal Adwan Hospital, one of only three medical facilities on the northern edge of the Gaza Strip, on Friday, ordering dozens of patients and hundreds of others to evacuate the compound, officials said.

Title: Brazil says workers at China's BYD site are victims of human traf...
Description: Chinese workers at a construction site in Brazil for a factory owned by China's electric vehicle producer BYD are victims of human trafficking, Brazilian labor authorities said on Thursday in a growing controversy in BYD's biggest overseas market.

Title: Unemployment rate among N. Korean defectors in S. Korea jumps to ...
Description: The unemployment rate among North Korean defectors living in South Korea jumped to 6.3 percent this year, as the sluggish economy increased joblessness among female defectors, data showed Friday.

Title: Trump's N. Korea policy may shake up security landscape on Korean...
Description: U.S. President-elect Donald Trump's policy toward North Korea could shake up the security landscape on the Korean Peninsula, leaving South Korea with the daunting challenge of formulating a strategy to coordinate with Washington, a state think tank said Friday.

Title: Finland boards oil tanker suspected of causing internet, power ca...
Description: Finnish authorities on Thursday seized a ship carrying Russian oil in the Baltic Sea on suspicion it caused the outage of an undersea power cable connecting Finland and Estonia a day earlier, and that it also damaged or broke four internet lines.

Title: Canadian foreign, finance ministers to meet Trump team on tariffs
Description: Key members of Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau's cabinet traveled to Florida on Thursday for talks with representatives of U.S. President-elect Donald Trump, as Ottawa works to avert a potentially devastating trade war.

Title: India's former PM Manmohan Singh dies aged 92
Description: Manmohan Singh, the former Indian prime minister whose economic reforms made his country a global powerhouse, has died at the age of 92.

Title: Ukraine possibly captures 1st N. Korean prisoner of war: report
Description: Ukrainian forces have likely captured a North Korean prisoner of war in what could be the first instance of its kind, a Ukrainian news report has said, as North Korean troops were fighting alongside Russia against Ukraine.

Title: Israel strikes Houthi rebels in Yemen's capital while WHO chief s...
Description: A new round of Israeli airstrikes in Yemen on Thursday targeted the Houthi rebel-held capital and multiple ports, while the World Health Organization's director-general said the bombardment occurred nearby as he prepared to board a flight in Sanaa, with a crew member injured.

Title: Aviation experts say Russia's air defense fire likely caused Azer...
Description: Aviation experts said Thursday that Russian air defense fire was likely responsible for the Azerbaijani plane crash the day before that killed 38 people and left all 29 survivors injured.

Title: Putin hopes for continued cooperation with N. Korea in his New Ye...
Description: Russian President Vladimir Putin has sent a New Year's message to North Korean leader Kim Jong-un, expressing hopes that the two nations will continue to cooperate in the next year, Pyongyang's state media reported Friday.

Title: More than 10,000 migrants died this year trying to reach Spain by...
Description: More than 10,000 migrants died while trying to reach Spain by sea this year, a report released by a Spanish migration rights group said on Thursday.

Title: What fate awaits undocumented Chinese migrants in US under Donald...
Description: As president-elect Donald Trump made his plans to deport millions of undocumented migrants known, Chinese border crossers began flooding group chats voicing fear that their stay in the U.S. could be precariously short.

Title: JAL's systems back to normal after cyberattack delayed flights
Description: Japan Airlines (JAL) said on Thursday its systems returned to normal, with same-day ticket sales resuming, after a cyberattack delayed some domestic and international flights.

Title: Seoul sanctions 15 NK IT workers, 1 entity over illicit funding f...
Description: South Korea said Thursday it will impose independent sanctions on 15 North Korean IT workers and one entity over their roles in the illicit cyber activities to fund the country's nuclear and missile development.

Title: Desi Bouterse, dictator convicted of murder who twice ruled Surin...
Description: Desi Bouterse, a military strongman who led a 1980 coup in the former Dutch colony of Suriname then returned to power by election three decades later despite charges of drug smuggling and murder, has died. He was 79.

Title: Pope urges all nations to silence arms and overcome divisions in ...
Description: VATICAN CITY — Pope Francis in his traditional Christmas message on Wednesday urged 'all people of all nations' to find courage during this Holy Year 'to silence the sounds of arms and overcome divisions' plaguing the world, from the Middle East to Ukraine, Africa to Asia.

Title: Pakistani bombardment in Afghanistan killed 46 people, Afghan Tal...
Description: Bombardment by the Pakistani army in Afghanistan's eastern Paktika province on Tuesday killed at least 46 people, most of whom were children and women, said the Afghan Taliban, vowing to retaliate against their neighbour.

Title: Zelensky condemns Russian 'inhumane' Christmas attack on energy g...
Description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky on Wednesday denounced an 'inhumane' attack from Russia, which launched over 170 missiles and drones on his war-torn country's power grid on Christmas Day, killing an energy worker.

Title: Passenger plane crashes in Kazakhstan: emergencies ministry
Description: A passenger plane crashed near the city of Aktau in Kazakhstan on Wednesday and initial reports suggested there were survivors, the Central Asian country's Emergencies Ministry said in a statement.

Title: Japan's top diplomat in China to address 'challenges'
Description: Japanese Foreign Minister Takeshi Iwaya met counterpart Wang Yi and other top officials in Beijing on Wednesday, after Tokyo acknowledged 'challenges and concerns' in ties.

Title: Santa Claus global flight to deliver presents underway
Description: Santa Claus took off early Christmas Eve aboard his reindeer-powered sleigh to deliver presents around the world.

Title: Cities worldwide hold subdued Christmas Eve celebrations amid con...
Description: Bethlehem marked another somber Christmas Eve on Tuesday in the traditional birthplace of Jesus under the shadow of war in Gaza .

Title: Crypto mogul Kwon's appeal against extradition verdict rejected a...
Description: Montenegro's Constitutional Court has dismissed an appeal lodged by Korean crypto mogul Do Kwon over a verdict on his extradition, a report said Tuesday.

Title: Biden signs annual defense policy bill, including maintaining USF...
Description: President Joe Biden has signed into law an annual defense policy bill that calls for maintaining some 28,500 American troops in Korea and reaffirming the United States' deterrence commitment to the Asian ally, according to the White House.

Title: Snowstorm cuts power to tens of thousands in Bosnia
Description: Parts of Bosnia and Herzegovina were cut off and more than 170,000 people were left without electricity on Tuesday due to a snowstorm gripping the region.

Title: Hong Kong police issue arrest warrants and bounties for six activ...
Description: Hong Kong police on Tuesday announced a fresh round of arrest warrants for six activists based overseas, with bounties set at $1 million Hong Kong dollars for information leading to their arrests.

Title: Global hunger monitor says famine in war-torn Sudan is spreading
Description: Famine in Sudan has expanded to five areas and will likely spread to another five by May, the global hunger monitor reported Tuesday, while warring parties continue to disrupt humanitarian aid needed to alleviate one of the worst starvation crises in modern times.

Title: Denmark investing in Greenland's defense as Trump eyes territory
Description: The Danish Defence Ministry announced on Tuesday a massive new defence expenditure centred on Greenland, the Arctic territory rich in minerals and natural resources that Copenhagen lays claim to and which US President-elect Donald Trump covets.

Title: American imprisoned in Russia sentenced to new 15-year jail term ...
Description: A Russian-born U.S. citizen already imprisoned in Russia on a bribery conviction has been handed a second 15-year jail term for espionage, Russian news agencies reported Tuesday.

Title: Bethlehem is set to mark a second subdued Christmas during the wa...
Description: Bethlehem prepared Tuesday to mark another somber Christmas in the traditional birthplace of Jesus under the shadow of war in Gaza.

Title: Biden will decide on US Steel acquisition after influential panel...
Description: A powerful government panel on Monday failed to reach consensus on the possible national security risks of a nearly $15 billion proposed deal for Nippon Steel of Japan to purchase U.S. Steel, leaving the decision to President Joe Biden, who opposes the deal.

Title: Trump again calls to buy Greenland after eyeing Canada and Panama...
Description: First it was Canada, then the Panama Canal. Now, Donald Trump again wants Greenland.

Title: NASA solar probe to make its closest ever pass of Sun
Description: NASA's pioneering Parker Solar Probe is poised to make its closest-ever approach of the Sun on Christmas Eve, a record-setting 3.8 million miles (6.2 million kilometers) from the surface.

Title: 5 OCD research findings that could drive new treatment, from gut ...
Description: This festive season, you may be spending time with loved ones who suffer from mental health conditions such as anxiety, depression or obsessive-compulsive disorder (OCD).

Title: US intelligence agencies believe troop dispatch to Russia was NK'...
Description: U.S. intelligence agencies believe that North Korea's troop deployment to Russia was Pyongyang's idea, The New York Times (NYT) reported Monday, although some Western officials thought Moscow had turned to the reclusive regime in a desperate need for military manpower amid its war in Ukraine.

Title: Young mammoth remains found nearly intact in Siberian permafrost
Description: Researchers in Siberia are conducting tests on a juvenile mammoth whose remarkably well-preserved remains were discovered in thawing permafrost after more than 50,000 years.

Title: Over 3,000 N. Korean soldiers killed, wounded in Kursk: Zelenskyy
Description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said Monday that over 3,000 North Korean soldiers have been killed or wounded fighting against Ukraine's incursion in Russia's Kursk region.

Title: NK troops likely to march in 2025 Moscow victory day parade: Krem...
Description: Kremlin foreign policy advisor Yuri Ushakov said on Monday that he thought it likely that North Korean soldiers would take part in next year's Moscow's Red Square parade to commemorate the Soviet victory over Nazi Germany in World War II.

Title: Honda, Nissan aim to merge by 2026 in historic pivot
Description: Honda and Nissan are in talks to merge by 2026, they said on Monday, a historic pivot for Japan's auto industry that underlines the threat Chinese electric vehicle (EV) makers now pose to the world's long-dominant legacy car makers.

Title: US probes Chinese chip industry on 'anticompetitive' concerns
Description: The United States said Monday it is opening an investigation into China's policies for its semiconductor industry, over concerns that Beijing is turning to 'extensive anticompetitive and non-market means' to undermine other economies.

Title: Suspect in deadly Christmas market attack railed against Islam, G...
Description: The Saudi suspect in Germany's deadly car-ramming attack on a Christmas market held strongly anti-Islam views and was angry with Germany's migrant and asylum policy, officials said Saturday.

Title: Ukrainian military unveils false IDs used by NK troops deployed t...
Description: Ukraine's military unveiled what it claimed were false identification documents carried by North Korean troops killed in the war with Russia, a report showed, amid Kyiv's claim that Russia is trying to conceal the presence of North Korean soldiers.

Title: N. Korea preparing for additional troop deployment, suicide drone...
Description: North Korea appears to be preparing to deploy additional troops and military equipment to Russia, possibly including suicide drones, in support of Moscow's war against Ukraine, the South's military said Monday.

Title: N. Korea portrays leader Kim as 'benevolent father' in flood reco...
Description: North Korea touted the recovery of the country's flood-damaged northwestern regions as 'miracles' in reports released Monday, using the occasion to portray leader Kim Jong-un as a 'benevolent father.'

Title: Trump says he might demand Panama hand over canal
Description: President-elect Donald Trump on Saturday accused Panama of charging excessive rates for use of the Panama Canal and said that if Panama did not manage the canal in an acceptable fashion, he would demand the U.S. allay hand it over.

Title: Putin vows more 'destruction' on Ukraine after drone attack on Ru...
Description: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Sunday vowed to bring more 'destruction' to Ukraine in retaliation for a drone attack on a high-rise apartment block in the central Russian city of Kazan a day earlier.

Title: Syria leader vows country will not negatively interfere in Lebano...
Description: Syria's new leader Ahmed al-Sharaa told Lebanese Druze leaders on Sunday that his country would not negatively interfere in Lebanon and would respect its neighbour's sovereignty.

Title: Starbucks workers' union strikes across US as talks hit impasse
Description: Some members of the Starbucks workers' union that represents more than 10,000 baristas walked off their jobs in multiple U.S. cities on Friday, citing unresolved issues over wages, staffing and schedules.

Title: US strikes Huthi targets in Yemen, hours after rebels hit Israel
Description: The United States on Saturday said it struck targets in Yemen's rebel-held capital, hours after a Huthi rebel missile wounded people in Israel's commercial hub Tel Aviv.

Title: China faces AI talent shortage in an otherwise booming 'new econo...
Description: China's booming artificial intelligence (AI) industry has a plethora of job openings but not enough talent to fill them, according to a recent report from Maimai, a Chinese professional online network similar to LinkedIn.

Title: First grief, then more political tone at site of Germany Christma...
Description: A spontaneous memorial created by grieving families and local residents at a church overlooking Magdeburg's Christmas market evolved during Saturday into something more politically charged.

Title: Biden signs bill that averts government shutdown, brings close to...
Description: President Joe Biden signed a bill into law Saturday that averts a government shutdown, bringing a final close to days of upheaval after Congress approved a temporary funding plan just past the deadline and refused President-elect Donald Trump’s core debt demands in the package.

Title: N. Korean leader attends ceremony for rebuilt houses in flood-hit...
Description: North Korean leader Kim Jong-un has attended a ceremony marking the completion of houses rebuilt after July's floods, emphasizing enhanced disaster response and self-rehabilitation, the country's state media reported Sunday.

Title: Malaysia agrees to resume 'no find, no fee' hunt for flight MH370...
Description: Malaysia's government has agreed in principle to accept a second 'no find, no fee' proposal from a U.S. company to renew the hunt for flight MH370, which is believed to have crashed in the southern Indian Ocean more than 10 years ago, Transport Minister Anthony Loke said Friday.

Title: US Senate passes government funding bill, averts shutdown
Description: The U.S. Congress passed spending legislation early on Saturday in a down-to-the wire burst of activity that will avert a destabilizing government shutdown ahead of the busy holiday travel season. The Democratic-controlled Senate in an 85-11 vote passed the bill to continue government funding 38 minutes after it expired at midnight (local times). The government did not invoke shutdown procedures in the interim.

Title: Numerous people injured after car drives into Christmas market in...
Description: Numerous people were injured on Friday after a car drove into a crowd of revellers at a Christmas market in the German city of Magdeburg, a city spokesperson told local broadcaster MDR.

Title: N. Korea slams S. Korea-US-Japan talks on Indo-Pacific as 'insult...
Description: North Korea lambasted a recent trilateral meeting between South Korea, the United States and Japan that discussed peace in the Indo-Pacific region, deriding the talks as an 'insult' to peace Saturday.

Title: N. Korean leader calls for stronger rural economies
Description: North Korean leader Kim Jong-un called to step up development of the country's industrial production in regions outside Pyongyang to strengthen rural economies, state media KCNA said on Saturday.

Title: Trump wants NATO members to increase defense spending to 5% of GD...
Description: Incoming U.S. President Donald Trump's team has told European officials that he will demand North Atlantic Treaty Organization (NATO) member states raise their defense spending to 5 percent of gross domestic product (GDP), the Financial Times reported Friday, citing people familiar with the matter.

Title: Ukrainian military unveils footage of drone attacks on NK soldier...
Description: The Ukrainian military released more video footage of its forces apparently killing North Korean soldiers with a drone on the frontlines in the Kursk border region, a Ukrainian media outlet has reported, amid reports of North Korean forces suffering heavy casualties.

Title: N. Korean economy grows 3.1% in 2023, snapping 3-year contraction...
Description: North Korea's economy expanded by more than 3 percent last year, rebounding from three consecutive years of contraction, data showed Friday, on the back of increased trade with China following the easing of border restrictions in the post-COVID-19 period.

Title: US suffers first severe human case of bird flu; California declar...
Description: The U.S. reported its first severe human case of bird flu on Wednesday in a Louisiana resident who is hospitalized in critical condition after suspected contact with an infected backyard flock.

Title: Putin boasts of gains in Ukraine at annual news conference meant ...
Description: President Vladimir Putin boasted that his military operation in Ukraine has strengthened Russia and denied that the ouster of key ally Bashar Assad in Syria had hurt Moscow’s prestige, as he took questions at his annual news conference and call-in show Thursday.

Title: House rejects Trump-backed plan on government shutdown, leaving n...
Description: With a resounding no, the House rejected President-elect Donald Trump's new plan Thursday to fund federal operations and suspend the debt ceiling a day before a government shutdown, as Democrats and dozens of Republicans refused to accommodate his sudden demands.

Title: Bank of England warns of 'heightened uncertainty' as it keeps int...
Description: The U.K.’s central bank warned Thursday of 'heightened uncertainty' as it kept interest rates on hold after inflation moved further above target, even at a time when the British economy is flatlining at best.

Title: Gisele Pelicot's ex-husband found guilty of rapes, sentenced to 2...
Description: A court in France on Thursday sentenced the ex-husband of Gisele Pelicot to 20 years in prison for drugging and raping her and allowing other men to rape her while she was unconscious, in abuse that lasted nearly a decade.

Title: More than 100 NK soldiers killed, over 1000 injured in Russia-Ukr...
Description: At least 100 North Korean soldiers deployed to fight against Ukrainian forces in Russia's Kursk region have been killed, with nearly 1,000 reported injured, the National Intelligence Service (NIS) said, Thursday. This marks the first official confirmation from South Korea's intelligence agency regarding the scale of casualties among North Korean troops in Russia.

Title: Gaza mediators intensify ceasefire efforts, Israeli strikes kill ...
Description: The United States, joined by Arab mediators, sought to conclude an agreement between Israel and Hamas to halt the 14-month-old war in the Gaza Strip, where medics said Israeli strikes killed at least 20 Palestinians on Wednesday.

Title: US Supreme Court agrees to review law banning Chinese-owned video...
Description: The U.S. Supreme Court said on Wednesday that it had agreed to review a U.S. law that mandates a nationwide ban of the popular Chinese-owned video app TikTok if it fails to secure a non-Chinese buyer by January 19.

Title: Yen drops as Bank of Japan maintains key interest rate
Description: The yen fell against the dollar on Thursday as the Bank of Japan (BoJ) left borrowing costs unchanged, extending a retreat for the currency after the Federal Reserve forecast fewer rate cuts.

Title: N. Korea can produce ballistic missiles for Russia to use against...
Description: North Korea demonstrated this year that it could produce ballistic missiles and supply them to Russia for use against Ukraine in a matter of months, the head of a research organization that traces weapons used in the war said Wednesday.

Title: US alarmed Russia close to accepting nuclear-armed N. Korea
Description: The United States voiced alarm at the United Nations Security Council on Wednesday that Russia was close to accepting a nuclear-armed North Korea, as Moscow and Pyongyang defended their growing cooperation.

Title: Fed lowers rates but sees fewer cuts in 2025 due to stubbornly hi...
Description: The U.S. central bank lowered interest rates on Wednesday, but Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell said more reductions in borrowing costs hinge on further progress in lowering stubbornly high inflation, remarks that showed policymakers are beginning to reckon with the prospects for sweeping economic change under an incoming Trump administration.

Title: France's highest court upholds Sarkozy's corruption conviction
Description: The Cour de Cassation, France's highest court, upheld on Wednesday former President Nicolas Sarkozy's conviction for corruption and influence peddling.

Title: Xi visits casino hub Macao to mark 25 years of its return to Chin...
Description: Chinese President Xi Jinping on Wednesday began a three-day visit to Macao to mark the 25th anniversary of the casino city’s return to Chinese rule.

Title: First flight since Assad's fall departs Syrian capital
Description: The first flight since the ouster of Syria's president Bashar al-Assad took off on Wednesday from Damascus airport to Aleppo in the country's north, AFP journalists saw.

Title: Honda, Nissan move to deepen ties, including possible merger: sou...
Description: Honda and Nissan are in talks to deepen ties, two people said on Wednesday, including a possible merger, the clearest sign yet of how Japan's once seemingly unbeatable auto industry is being reshaped by challenges from Tesla and Chinese rivals.

Title: Power failed at SpaceX mission control before September spacewalk...
Description: A September power outage at a California facility of SpaceX, the space venture of billionaire entrepreneur Elon Musk, caused a loss of ground control for at least an hour during a mission that included the first private spacewalk in history, according to three people familiar with the problem.

Title: What does Big Tech hope to gain from warming up to Trump?
Description: In a string of visits, dinners, calls, monetary pledges and social media overtures, big tech chiefs - including Apple's Tim Cook , OpenAI’s Sam Altman , Meta’s Mark Zuckerberg , SoftBank's Masayoshi Son and Amazon’s Jeff Bezos - have joined a parade of business and world leaders in trying to improve their standing with President-elect Donald Trump before he takes office in January.

Title: Netanyahu says Israeli troops will occupy buffer zone inside Syri...
Description: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said Tuesday that Israeli forces will stay in a buffer zone on the Syrian border, seized after the ouster of Syria's President Bashar Assad, until another arrangement is in place 'that ensures Israel's security.'

Title: Gaza ceasefire talks gain momentum as officials push for deal
Description: An agreement to halt the 14-month-old war in Gaza and free hostages held in the Palestinian enclave could be signed in the coming days with talks in Cairo making progress, sources briefed on the meeting said on Tuesday.

Title: Ukraine kills Russian chemical weapons chief Igor Kirillov in Mos...
Description: A top Russian general accused by Ukraine of being responsible for the use of chemical weapons against Ukrainian troops was assassinated in Moscow by Ukraine's SBU intelligence service on Tuesday morning in the most high-profile killing of its kind.

Title: N. Korean leader visits mausoleum to pay tribute to late father o...
Description: North Korean leader Kim Jong-un has visited a mausoleum for his late father to mark the 13th anniversary of his death, the North's state media reported Wednesday.

Title: US sanctions 2 individuals, 1 entity involved in money laundering...
Description: The United States on Tuesday sanctioned two individuals and one entity involved in a network that launders illicit funds generated by North Korean IT workers and cybercrime to support Pyongyang, the Treasury Department said.

Title: UN General Assembly adopts resolution on N. Korean human rights f...
Description: The U.N. General Assembly on Tuesday passed a resolution on North Korean human rights for the 20th consecutive year, calling for improvement in the reclusive state's human rights record.

Title: UN Security Council to hold briefing on NK-Russia military cooper...
Description: The U.N. Security Council (UNSC) is set to hold a briefing later this week to discuss North Korea's deepening military cooperation with Russia, amid growing concerns over North Korean troops' engagement in combat alongside Russian forces against Ukraine.

Title: Hundreds of N. Korean troops killed, wounded in battle with Ukrai...
Description: Hundreds of North Korean troops fighting alongside Russian soldiers against Ukrainian forces in the Kursk region have been killed or wounded, according to news reports that cited a U.S. military official.

Title: Denmark will not extradite anti-whaling activist Paul Watson to J...
Description: Denmark has rejected a Japanese request to extradite anti-whaling activist Paul Watson over criminal charges dating back more than a decade, a Danish lawyer representing Watson said on Tuesday.

Title: Stock markets mostly drop awaiting Fed policy update
Description: Major stock markets mostly fell Tuesday as attention turned to the Federal Reserve's upcoming policy decision, with traders hoping for guidance on its interest rate plans as president-elect Donald Trump prepares to take office.

Title: Donald Trump's deportation plan sparks fear, doubt, skepticism
Description: President-elect Donald Trump promises to undertake the largest deportation program in U.S. history, prompting fear among immigrants, although immigration attorneys say it will be a tall task.

Title: Americans' trust in nation's court system hits record low, survey...
Description: At a time of heightened political division, Americans' confidence in their country’s judicial system and courts dropped to a record low of 35 percent this year, according to a new Gallup poll .
